description.narrative: The project development objective is to enhance resilience and connectivity to minimize impacts from floods in the Targeted Districts in the Kosi River Basin and to enhance Bihar's capacity to respond promptly and effectively to an Eligible Crisis or Emergency.

participating-org.narrative: Bihar Aapada Punarwas Evam Punarnirman Society (BAPEPS)
Bihar Rajya Pul Nirman Nigam Limited (BRPNNL)

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Consulting Firm | Description :BAPEPs to select and hire a consulting firm for purposes of carrying outindependent annual environmental and social audits, monitoring and supervision activities and validate the BAPEP's, theImplementing Agencies, FIGs, POs and contractors compliance with the safeguard documents. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Contingency Emergency Response (CER) Operations Manual | Description :In order to trigger CER comp., Biharshall: (i) prepare and furnish to the Association for approval a CER OM detailing activities, expenditures and implementationarrangements; (ii) identify and maintain Coordinating Authority with adequate staff and resources; (iii) declare (jointly with theGoI and the Association) an eligible crisis or emergency; (iv) prepare and disclose required Safeguard doc | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Contractors Safeguards Obligations | Description :BAPEPS and the Implementing Agencies to include compliancewith the Safeguard Documents as part of the contractors obligations pursuant to the bidding documents. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :District Project Management Units (DPMUs) | Description :BAPEPS to establish and maintain in each targeteddistrict DPMUs adequately staffed with qualified personnel in order to coordinate the day to day implementation of projectactivities. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Environment and Social Specialists | Description :BAPEPS to maintain a qualified and experienced environment andsocial spec. to be responsible for (a) regularly updating the ESMF; (b) providing training and orientation to BAPEPs and IAsstaff; (c) reviewing and/or clearing environmental screenings/assessmentsof project activities, the EMPs and RAPs, monitoringreports submitted; (d) regular field visits to review compliance with safeguard doc | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Financial Management Consulting Firm | Description :BAPEPS to select, hire and retain a financial managementconsulting firm to assist BAPEPS and the implementing agencies with the carrying out of its fiduciary responsibilities. | Frequency:CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Grievance Redressal/ Complaints Processing | Description :BAPEPS and/or the implementing agencies shall maintainand operate district level grievance redressal and complaints processing cells for the handling of any stakeholder complaintsarising out of the project implementation activities. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Implementation Units - I | Description :BAPEPS shall be vested with the overall responsibility for projectimplementation, monitoring and evaluation, to this end, BAPEPS shall be granted the powers functions, competencies, staff andresources required for guaranteeing inter-departmental coordination, monitoring, supervision and implementation of projectactivities. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Ineligible Expenditures | Description :BAPEPS and/or the implementing agencies to pay for any land acquisition,and resettlement and rehabilitation cash compensations (payments) exclusively out of its own resources. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Mid-term Impact Evaluation Study | Description :BAPEPS and Implementing Agencies to carry out a mid-term Projectsocial and environmental impact evaluation study identifying any weaknesses and/or delays, and setting out any necessary remedialmeasures. | Due Date :31-Dec-2018

Finance Agreement :Nodal Officers | Description :Implementing agencies to appoint and maintain qualified and experienced social andenvironmental nodal officers, each responsible for applying the safeguard documents to the project activities, ensuring compliancewith their provisions and obtaining the regulatory environmental clearances and permits, and reporting to BAPEPS on social andenvironmental aspects of the Project. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Procurement Disclosure | Description :BAPEPS and/or the Implementing Agencies shall disclose in a freely andpublicly accessible website the updated procurement information related to the Project (e.g. procurement notices, invitation tobid., biding documents, and status of bidding processes and any complaints). | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Project Documents | Description :BAPEPS and the Implementing Agencies to implement their respective parts of theProject in accordance with the Operations Manual. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Project Implementation Unit and District Project Implementation Units | Description :Implementing Agencies(other than BAPEPS) to establish and maintain: (i) a PIU to carry out daily planning and implementation activities, includingliaising and coordinating the implementation of project activities with the DPMUs; (ii) DPIUs (in each targeted dist.), to carryout filed-level day-to-day planning and implementation of project activities, including liaising with DPMUs. | Frequency:CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Project-end Social and Environmental Report | Description :BAPES and the Implementing Agencies to prepare anindependent assessment report on BAPEPS and the Implementing Agencies observance of/compliance with Safeguard Documents and thesocial and environmental impact of Project activities. | Due Date :31-Dec-2021/ delayed significantly

Finance Agreement :Safeguard Documents | Description :BAPEPS, the implementing agencies, the FIGs and POs to implement the Projectin accordance with the ESMF, EMPs, RAPs (the “Safeguard Documents”). | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Screening of Project Activities and Government Permits/Clearances | Description :BAPEPS, the IAs, FIGS or POs torefrain from tendering or financing Matching Grants/Business Plan unless the activities has been screened as per ESMF and EMP andRAP have been prepared, cleared with Association and disclosed for 120 days and all government clearances have been obtained andrelocation assistance/ displacement compensations paid. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Third Party Quality Consulting Firm | Description :BAPEPS to select, hire and retain a third party qualityconsulting firm to assist BAPEPS with the carrying out of quality monitoring of project related activities, including compliancewith Safeguards Documents. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

For activities under comp. 2.1 and 2.2, the AFRD shall: (i) screen and subsequently select the proposals for Business Plans and/orABC Business Plans submitted by FIGs and POs respectively for financing through Matching Grants; and (ii) enter into MatchingGrantsAgreements with the selected FIGs and POs for the financing of their respective proposal, as agreed with Association anddetailed in OM

title.narrative: Women and socially excluded farmers, with increased access to markets by roads and bridges that are in good & fair condition
Women/ SC/ ST/ Small and Marginal Producers/ Rearers supported directly to build livestock and fishery assets
Producers/ Rearers supported directly to build livestock and fishery assets
Funds immediately available to respond to a major disaster
WRD staff trained to use flood management technologies
Increased access of the population to markets by roads and bridges that are in good & fair condition
Rural households that have diversified and/or strengthened their livelihood portfolio
Area protected by improved flood protection measures
